week3.practice1_html:
Toby, right now you‚Äôre in the peak shedding phase‚Äîyour February illness + September over-exercise created overlapping stress and your hair is still in the ‚Äúfall before stabilize‚Äù window. The fastest lever you can pull is your first meal of the day. A steady, protein-rich breakfast calms morning cortisol (already running hot with your high stress + short sleep) and feeds follicles what they‚Äôve been missing, so you can cross from shedding ‚Üí stabilization sooner. üå±

What to do

  • Eat within 1 hour of waking for a cortisol ‚Äúbrake.‚Äù
  • Target 25‚Äì30 g protein + color (plants, fiber) at breakfast.
  • Keep it anti-inflammatory: swap refined carbs for oats, berries, greens.
  • Rotate vegan + omnivore options so breakfast stays enjoyable and doable.

Your plan

  • Omnivore fast option: Greek yogurt + berries + 2 boiled eggs (‚âà28 g protein).
  • Vegan quickie: Soy milk smoothie with frozen spinach, banana, oats, pea protein (30 g).
  • Savory base: Leftover chicken or tofu in a veggie scramble or wrap.
  • Prep overnight oats / smoothie bags the night before to save effort on stressful mornings.

Step-by-step implementation

  1. Decide a 3-option breakfast ‚Äúrotation‚Äù you actually like.
  2. Shop + prep 2 nights per week, so your mornings feel automatic under stress.
  3. Avoid only coffee until 11 a.m. ‚Üí it spikes cortisol, worsens shedding pressure.
  4. If late caffeine sneaks in, balance by front-loading breakfast protein next morning.
  5. Notice mood steadiness: less mid-morning anxiety = hair protection signal.

Why this works (for you)

  • Protein + early calories soften cortisol peaks wired by illness + over-exercise ‚Üí fewer follicles forced into telogen.
  • Your heavy stress + 6h sleep suggests weaker repair signals. Anchoring breakfast restores circadian rhythm and balances blood sugar, lightening the load on hair cycling.
  • You‚Äôre still within the delay window: February illness means Sep‚ÄìOct is worst. These breakfasts pull stabilization forward so regrowth can start on schedule this winter.
  • With irregular cycles, nourishing protein also supports hormones that buffer stress-driven shedding.

What to look out for

  • Red flags: Skipping breakfast ‚Üí mid-morning crash + caffeine reliance = more night wakeups. Respond by prepping grab-and-go portions.
  • Green lights: By week 2 you feel steadier energy; by week 3 less ‚Äúhandful‚Äù shedding on wash days; mood less jagged mid-mornings.
  • Be gentle, Toby‚Äîevery calm, protein-filled morning is one brick laid toward steadier shedding and regrowth. ‚ù§Ô∏è
week3.practice1_title: Practice 1: Win Your Day with Breakfast
